items.title: 1 Dividend Stock Down 30% to Buy and Hold for the Next Decade
items.author: Prosper Junior Bakiny
items.description: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals faces challenges with its Eylea drug, but its Dupixent treatment and promising pipeline, including a gene therapy for congenital deafness, make it an attractive long-term investment. The company's capital allocation priorities, including a new dividend and share buybacks, further enhance its appeal.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Despite facing headwinds with its Eylea drug, Regeneron has strong growth drivers in Dupixent and a promising pipeline, including a groundbreaking gene therapy. The company's capital allocation priorities, including a new dividend and share buybacks, further enhance its appeal as a long-term investment.
The article mentions Amgen's Pavblu, a biosimilar version of Eylea, as a competitor to Regeneron's Eylea, but does not provide a detailed assessment of Amgen's performance or outlook.
Sanofi co-markets Dupixent with Regeneron, and the article highlights Dupixent's strong performance and growth potential, which benefits Sanofi as Regeneron's partner.
